xuiSlider
directive in module xui

Description

Slider element provides solution for quick and easy selecting value or value-pair (range) between an interval.

Usage

as element:
<xui-slider
       [caption="{string}"]
       [unit="{string}"]
       is-disabled="{boolean}"
       type="{string}"
       value="{number}"
       start-value="{number}"
       end-value="{number}"
       min="{number}"
       max="{number}"
       min-range="{number}"
       step="{number}"
       on-change="{Function}"
       is-textinput-enabled="{boolean}"
       update-on-drag="{boolean}"
       fraction-size="{number}">
</xui-slider>

Parameters

ParamTypeDetails
caption
(optional)
string

Caption of the component.

unit
(optional)
string

The unit written after the caption.

is-disabledboolean

Expression to disable the slider.

(default: false)

typestring

Type of the slider. Values: 'range' or 'single'.

(default: 'range')

valuenumber

The value of the slider. Required if slider's type='single'.

start-valuenumber

The starting value for the slider. Required if slider's type='range'.

end-valuenumber

The ending value for the slider. Required if slider's type='range'.

minnumber

The minimum settable value of the slider.

maxnumber

The maximum settable value of the slider.

min-rangenumber

The minimum range if slider's type='range'.

stepnumber

The slider will be enforced to allow only the n * step values where n is integer and greater than 0.

on-changeFunction

Callback that is invoked on user initiated value change

is-textinput-enabledboolean

If set to true and slider type is "single", the slider has text field that accepts direct input. Will not display a value above the handler.

(default: false)

update-on-dragboolean

If set to true, the value model will also change when dragging.

(default: false)

fraction-sizenumber

The number of decimal places to round the values to.

(default: 0)

Example
